intro: Dalechampia erythrostyla, commonly known as the red-styled dalechampia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbellate inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
